item.description:
Join us for a fun afternoon in the North End of Boston

It's spring and trees are in bloom. Perhaps among the loveliest are the Magnolias, and one of the nicest places to shoot them is in the courtyard of St. Leonard's in the North End.

If you're a photographer, you find an opportunity to shoot the lovely trees in the afternoon light and serene setting, closeups of blossoms with your macro lens, interesting scenes from the courtyard setting, and perhaps an obliging visitor who likes being photographed.

You can also come if you are not a photographer, enjoy the scene, enjoy an espresso, biscotto with cappuccino, or a refreshing gelato, and perhaps fill in for a picture or two

Equipment:
Point and shoot cameras are useful here (and you'll see why flash can be useful in daytime). Of course, you'll get more creative with a DSLR, various lenses, and a fill flash.

The challenge will be about how to shoot people with light to their back while adding just enough light with your flash to illuminate their faces to avoid undesirable silhouetting. We'll also look at use of reflectors and discuss tips on shooting flowers.

Parking at Haymarket (MBTA map [here])

Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: In the Courtyard - Enter from Hanover St by Prince St
